text: Eudonia inexoptata is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Harrison Gray Dyar Jr. in 1929. It is found in Mexico. The wingspan is 16–22 mm. The forewings are grey, irrorated (speckled) with black scales. The inner line is pale, followed by a narrow black line. The terminal area is shaded with dark. The hindwings are pale sordid. Adults have been recorded on wing in June. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1929 Category:Scopariinae
title: Eudonia inexoptata
